page.title: 02SWALEDALE SHEEP/BREEDING
page.content: The main breed of sheep in the area are Swaledales.They are one of the hardiest hill breeds in Britain.They are kept on the moor where they originated.Swaledale ewes are often crossed with Blue faced Leicester tups to produce mule lambs.The gimmers are sold and bought by farmers farther down who have better land.The ewes are also crossed with suffolks to get a better store lamb.Dalesbred sheep are another hill breed kept in the area they are related to the Swaledale but not as common.Swaledale ewes and Dalesbred ewes are crossed with Teeswater or Wensleydale tups to produce Mashams the gimmers are sold like Mules.
